snippet: A dispute in Florida between a billionaire and a king’s brother-in-law could have ramifications for those who collect child support and alimony, lawyers say.
abstract: Paul Sullivan Wealth Matters column; court ruling in multimillion-dollar dispute between Florida billionaire Harry Sargeant III and Mohammad Anwar Farid Al-Saleh, brother-in-law to Jordan's King Abdullah II, could have far-reaching ramifications in state already known for having the strongest laws protecting debtors from creditors; some lawyers say Florida could become a haven for people running from child support and alimony payments.
lead_paragraph: A dispute in Florida between a billionaire and a king’s brother-in-law could have ramifications for those who collect child support and alimony, lawyers say.

headline.main: Ruling Could Escalate Florida’s Status as Haven for Debtors
headline.print_headline: Ruling Could Escalate Florida’s Status as Haven for Debtors
